thread.title: Energy drives up US producer prices rise in June
thread.title_full: Energy drives up US producer prices rise in June

title: Energy drives up US producer prices rise in June
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Jul 15, 2015, 14:52 BST - UK Markets close in 1 hr 38 mins Energy drives up US producer prices rise in June AFP â€“ 26 minutes ago View Photo 

US producer prices rose for the second straight month in June, led by higher energy prices, official data released Wednesday showed. 
The Labor Department said its producer price index (PPI) rose 0.4 percent in June, after a small upwardly revised 0.5 percent gain in May. Wholesale prices had fallen 0.4 percent in April. 
The June increase was led by a 0.7 percent jump in goods, much of it due to higher energy prices, up 2.4 percent, that included a 4.3 percent jump in gasoline prices. 
Food prices rose 0.6 percent. Egg prices soared 69.6 percent, after a 42.9 percent rise in May, as an avian flu outbreak has forced farmers to kill millions of chickens and other birds. 
Excluding food and energy prices, so-called "core" PPI rose 0.4 percent. 
Year-over-year, producer prices fell 0.7 percent in June, the fifth month in a row of declines. 
The pick-up in wholesale prices in June could add fuel to the Federal Reserve's plan to raise interest rates this year. The Fed has insisted muted inflation would eventually climb as the economy heals from the Great Recession. 
In prepared testimony to Congress on Wednesday, Fed Chair Janet Yellen stuck to her forecast for an increase in the central bank's zero-level federal funds rate, saying: "If the economy evolves as we expect, economic conditions likely would make it appropriate at some point this year to raise the federal funds rate target."
